text: Anybody know how to add the link to my stylesheet to the modules? I’ve setup a local project, running gulp with sass and browser sync. Normally we’d add to the head but we don’t have access to that. Can I add it to the actual module.html??
I haven’t done it, but I’d map the sass build to the css file of the module. Since each module allows HTML, CSS, and JS, that would be a good way to do it.

Hi guys, would like to ask for assistance. We are using gulp.js file to build and compile our css and js file, and upload it using vinyl-ftp. But upon running the upload, I am getting this error:`Error on output file. Unable to get folder at makeError with code: 551.`

As per this article: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/File-upload-fails-with-FTP-reply-code-551/m-p/234117#M13013>, they recommend restarting the FTP services but quite not sure about this.

I have created a new workspace and re-install node, gulp, etc..and I am getting this error now: `ECONNREFUSED`. Would there be a chance that there are changes in the format of connecting with an FTP client? Some changes in the port maybe?
wouldn’t I have to do that for every module? My modules are in named folders.
You'd have a sass file for each module.
But that's how components work anyways.
<@U6W3H6YN8>, thank you so much for releasing this, my team and I are super excited to get cracking on using Local-dev for HubSpot
It is our pleasure, Chris! We want your developer experience and workflow to be :100: :rocket: , and we look forward to continuing improve upon the functionality with your feedback.
it would be great if we could add images to the design folder so we could use relative links in the css file
Thanks for the feedback! We are working on collocation of all developer assets :wink:
Just realizing how helpful this tool is going to be for creating/maintaining a module library.

it would be great to have a mini-training on how to do that.

I  know many folks already have  an internal library / design system... but many don't.

A training would prob help others become aware of WHY it's key to build that + how to do it (with local dev). cc <@U3PKJ8EQL>
agreed.  In the past, it's been a bit of a challenge to move modules between portals, and keep track of what's been updated and where
Guess I left the agency world at the wrong time :wink:
Hmmmmmm. This may or may not fall inside the scope of the initial training I'm planning for this local stuff, but def good call.
if it falls outside, maybe we could get a community members to write up a blog post or something :slightly_smiling_face: Or speak about it at <#CCGU4R4ER|extend> (cc <@U7SL518D6>)
was planning on it lol
It could mean big things for <#CCQSQ2C6L|crankshaft> :wink: and other open source projects that’s what I see out of it

niiiiice <@U26BLKGE4>... we can record it and repurpose as a little training video.

I'd love to see more (all) HubSpot developers investing in building their own design system / asset library.

<@U26BLKGE4> Let me know if you're interested in producing something of Academy fidelity (on this or any other topic). We definitely do stuff with folks outside of HubSpot. I haven't done it with dev content yet since I've been kinda thrashing trying to meet the baseline needs, but it's something I definitely want to do more of in the future.
for sure man, shooting you a DM

Hi there local dev enthusiasts! If any of you run into stuff while you're digging into this that you'd love to see show up in future HubSpot Academy education, feel free to throw ideas in this doc: <https://docs.google.com/document/d/16BX3jUZD80QBglCSrC_mgwWfj4l_fzOlkwbY1x0bm04/edit?usp=sharing>. No specific requirements, quick brain dump is fine.
A bunch of my module throw this error when I sync, anyone else see this, or know why?
if you sync again, do they work?
the ESOCKETTIMEDOUT error is a low level network error that is thrown when hitting a network timeout
we have seen some issues when uploading modules that we’re investigating, but they seem to be intermittent.
no that doesn't help, maybe I just have too many?
not sure, yet
Hmm, doesn't throw those errors when I use `watch`
scratch that, still does sometimes :upside_down_face:
another potential cause could be files that are big if you’re on a slow connection because the client-side timeout is only 7 seconds right now, but i think it is something on our end
either way, thanks for letting us know. we’re looking into it.
